fr.inria.atlanmod.neoemf.util

Interface UriBuilder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractUriBuilder, BerkeleyDbUri, BlueprintsUri, HBaseUri, InMemoryUri, MapDbUri

    @ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
public interface UriBuilder
    A builder of URIs. Created URIs are used to locate a PersistentResource and select the BackendFactory to use for persistence.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String createScheme(java.lang.String baseName)
      Creates a URI scheme from the specified baseName.
      static UriBuilder forName(java.lang.String name)
      Retrieves the instance of UriBuilder that is associated to a BackendFactory wearing the given name.
      static UriBuilder forScheme(java.lang.String scheme)
      Retrieves the instance of UriBuilder that uses the given scheme.
      URI fromFile(java.io.File file)
      Creates a new URI from the given file descriptor.
      URI fromFile(java.lang.String filePath)
      Creates a new URI from the given file descriptor.
      URI fromServer(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String... segments)
      Creates a new URI from the host, port, and model by creating a hierarchical URI that references the distant model resource.
      URI fromServer(java.lang.String host, int port, URI model)
      Creates a new URI from the host, port, and model by creating a hierarchical URI that references the distant model resource.
      URI fromUri(URI uri)
      Creates a new URI from the given uri.
      boolean supportsFile()
      Checks that the BackendFactory associated to the created URI supports file-based storage.
      boolean supportsServer()
      Checks that the BackendFactory associated to the created URI supports server-based storage.

static java.lang.String createScheme(java.lang.String baseName)
        Creates a URI scheme from the specified baseName.
        Parameters:
        baseName - the base name of the scheme
        Returns:
        the URI scheme

      • forName

        @Nonnull
static UriBuilder forName(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieves the instance of UriBuilder that is associated to a BackendFactory wearing the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the factory
        Returns:
        a new instance of UriBuilder

      • forScheme

        @Nonnull
static UriBuilder forScheme(java.lang.String scheme)
        Retrieves the instance of UriBuilder that uses the given scheme.
        Parameters:
        scheme - the scheme of the builder
        Returns:
        a new instance of UriBuilder

      • supportsFile

        boolean supportsFile()
        Checks that the BackendFactory associated to the created URI supports file-based storage.
        Returns:
        true if file-based URIs are supported

      • supportsServer

        boolean supportsServer()
        Checks that the BackendFactory associated to the created URI supports server-based storage.
        Returns:
        true if server-based URIs are supported

      • fromUri

        @Nonnull
URI fromUri(URI uri)
        Creates a new URI from the given uri.

        This method checks that the scheme of the provided uri can be used to create a new UriBuilder. Its scheme must be registered in the BackendFactoryRegistry.

        Parameters:
        uri - the base file-based URI
        Returns:
        a new URI
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this URI builder does not support this method
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the uri is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the scheme of the provided uri is not registered in the BackendFactoryRegistry

      • fromFile

        @Nonnull
URI fromFile(java.lang.String filePath)
        Creates a new URI from the given file descriptor.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path of the File to build a URI from
        Returns:
        a new URI
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this URI builder does not support this method
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the filePath is null

      • fromFile

        @Nonnull
URI fromFile(java.io.File file)
        Creates a new URI from the given file descriptor.
        Parameters:
        file - the File to build a URI from
        Returns:
        a new URI
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this URI builder does not support this method
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the file is null

      • fromServer

        @Nonnull
URI fromServer(java.lang.String host,
                        int port,
                        URI model)
        Creates a new URI from the host, port, and model by creating a hierarchical URI that references the distant model resource.
        Parameters:
        host - the address of the server (use "localhost" if the server is running locally)
        port - the port of the server
        model - a URI identifying the model in the database
        Returns:
        a new URI
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this URI builder does not support this method
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if port < 0

      • fromServer

        @Nonnull
URI fromServer(java.lang.String host,
                        int port,
                        java.lang.String... segments)
        Creates a new URI from the host, port, and model by creating a hierarchical URI that references the distant model resource.
        Parameters:
        host - the address of the server (use "localhost" if the server is running locally)
        port - the port of the server
        segments - a string identifying the model in the database
        Returns:
        a new URI
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this URI builder does not support this method
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if port < 0
